Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: pointed out that other districts have lower thresholds for remediation; spoke at the school board meeting

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: “Now who is going to cover our medical bills? I demand you test all the kids in the district. I want to find out which kids are sick with lead poisoning!”
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: pointed out that other districts have lower thresholds for remediation; spoke at the school board meeting

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Teachers from Frick United Academy of Language demanded to know why, if testing took place in April, fountains weren’t shut down until August.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: from Frick United Academy of Language; raised concerns about the delayed shutdown of water fountains

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: In 2017, when OUSD was considering its clean drinking water policy, the cost to upgrade all the pipes would have been $38 million, Thomas said. Today, that number could be $50 or $60 million.
Document Sources.Name of Source: OUSD’s clean drinking water policy document (2017)
Document Sources.Source Justification: referenced by Preston Thomas to explain the estimated cost of upgrading pipes

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: The district’s safe drinking water policy states that any water sources showing lead at above 5 parts per billion must be taken offline and repaired.
Document Sources.Source Justification: cited to explain the district’s protocol for addressing lead contamination

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “This mistake has caused families stress, anxiety and panic, further limiting our community’s trust in this district,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: expressing concerns as a student representative

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I sincerely apologize for the stress and concern this has caused our school sites, students and families. We understand the gravity of this situation and we are fully committed to taking immediate, transparent and corrective action,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: apologizing and committing to action as the district’s leader

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “There is so much trust rebuilding that has to be done for our community. We have failed. And when I say ‘we’ I mean OUSD has failed at its most basic job of not poisoning our students,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Sixth-grade Science Teacher at Frick United Academy of Language
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: expressing concerns and criticism as a teacher
